abstract: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un is planning to visit Moscow in May, hoping to strengthen ties between nations whose relations with west have faltered; visit will mark Kim's first trip abroad since coming to power in 2011.
lead_paragraph: Kim Jong-un will attend a ceremony celebrating the defeat of Nazi Germany, in his first trip abroad since taking power.

byline.contributor: Choe Sang-Hun contributed reporting from Seoul, South Korea.

snippet: Kim Jong-un will attend a ceremony celebrating the defeat of Nazi Germany, in his first trip abroad since taking power.

headline.main: North Korean Leader to Visit Russia in May
headline.print_headline: North Korean Plans to Visit Russia in May
